dt.t: The primary job of the {wi}proctor{/wi} is to monitor students to ensure they're following testing room rules and not sharing answers.
If a test {wi}proctor{/wi} isn't following protocol, or test-takers haven't been given the correct amount of time, results can be skewed.

dt: {bc}an officer at a university who is responsible especially for disciplinary measures

dt.t: At night {wi}proctors{/wi} patrolled the street and dogged your steps if you tried to go into any haunt where the presence of vice was suspected.

utxt.t: Some of the teachers volunteered to {wi}proctor.{/wi}

et: Middle English {it}procutour{/it} procurator, proctor, alteration of {it}procuratour{/it}
shortdef: someone who supervises or monitors students:
an officer at a university who is responsible especially for disciplinary measures
